Alcohol damages as well brain but you cannot replace it without killing person.

I don't believe that people will be irresponsible, I mean sure some will at first. But once the insurance companies take control of the organ printing, it'll end up being that theres an "insentive" to get their insurance by offering one free organ replacement. 

The more ethical question to think of is when it comes to the human brain. We right now, do not fully understand it, but if we can bio-print a brain, will it still be that person?

The massive ethical question though, is when it comes down to the obvious. Who gets to decide who gets what organs?
